name: XtraVaganza
body: We’ll give them topics and they have to make their model using their ideas and bring their models to our college for the exhibition purpose and explain their model in front of our Coordinators and judges.

name: XpreXive
body: Transform trash into treasure! Show us your creativity by transforming waste into something beautiful and functional. Entries will be evaluated based on the uniqueness of the concept, the effectiveness of the transformation, the sustainability of the materials utilized, and the overall visual appeal and utility of the completed product.

name: Artistix
body: Let your brushes dance over the canvas! Paint your interpretation of the supplied themes. We would love to see artworks that not only demonstrate technical competence, but also communicate emotion, depth, and interpretation. Entries should be creative in their composition, color use, and overall visual impact.

name: UXplore
description: UI/UX Design is the process of creating products that provide meaningful and relevant experiences to users.
body: Each participant receives an idea for an app screen, micro-component, or micro-interaction. This idea could be anything from a login screen to a newsfeed interaction.

name: ClashDevs
description: Developing the frontend of a website or an application.
body: We will be providing an incomplete UI to the participants. They have to implement it with their inputs to complete the entire UI using only HTML, CSS, and Vanilla Js (No framework allowed) and deploy it on Vercel/netlify.

name: Cynox
description: CTF is a gamified event where participants compete to find and exploit vulnerabilities
body: Capture the Flag (CTF) An event is a gamified event where participants compete to find and exploit vulnerabilities in a simulated environment to capture "flags"

name: Eureka
description: WebAThon is a hackathon where participants compete to build a web application in a limited time
body: We have modified the generic webathon planning to a tech expo, where a product building boot camp will be organized where we will conduct workshops and a Product pitch deck battle where students will participate as a team and present us a product demo & presentation.

name: TraceIt
description: Search around the campus to find the hidden treasure.
body: The journey begins on a website you control. This serves as the entry point and landing page for participants.

name: Entangled
description: Maze Solver is a robot or system designed to navigate a maze from a starting point to a predefined destination using sensors, actuators, and decision-making algorithms.
body: A maze solver is an autonomous robot or system designed to navigate a maze from a starting point to a predefined destination using sensors, actuators, and decision-making algorithms.

name: EdrenaLine
description: Race cars are vehicles that can be controlled remotely using a handheld transmitter or controller.
body: RC race cars are vehicles that can be controlled remotely using a handheld transmitter or controller. The transmitter sends signals to the car's receiver, translating them into steering, acceleration, and braking.

name: SymbIoT
body: IOT Problem Identification, Solution Design, and Presentation - Demonstration.

name: Connectify
body: We’ll provide circuit materials and give them generalized questions that they have to solve by using provided circuit

name: XtraVaganza
body: We’ll give them topics and they have to make their model using their ideas and bring their models to our college for the exhibition purpose and explain their model in front of our Coordinators and judges.

name: WordCraftique
body: Express yourself with words! You will be given ideas to work with to create distinctive and inventive pieces. We would love to see entries that engage the reader with unique ideas, vivid imagery, and compelling storytelling, as well as exhibiting mastery of language and narrative style.

-Poetry(Max 20 lines)
Short Story(Max 1000 words)
Drama(Max 1000 words)
Creative Non-fiction (Max 1000 words)

rules.body: Will be announced 30 minutes prior to the event.
Paper will be provided by the college

body:
1. Original Work: All submissions must be original and unpublished pieces of writing created solely by the participant.
2. Adherence to Guidelines: Entries must adhere to the specified word limits and formatting guidelines for each category.
3. Respectful Content: Content must be appropriate for a diverse audience and refrain from containing offensive language, explicit content, or discriminatory themes.

name: Junkraft
body: Transform trash into treasure! Show us your creativity by transforming waste into something beautiful and functional. Entries will be evaluated based on the uniqueness of the concept, the effectiveness of the transformation, the sustainability of the materials utilized, and the overall visual appeal and utility of the completed product.
1. Required waste materials should be brought by the participants.
2. The focus should be on artistic composition, creativity, and design.

name: XpreXive
body: Transform trash into treasure! Show us your creativity by transforming waste into something beautiful and functional. Entries will be evaluated based on the uniqueness of the concept, the effectiveness of the transformation, the sustainability of the materials utilized, and the overall visual appeal and utility of the completed product.

1. Themes and relevant topics will be given on the spot, participants will be allowed to pick their topic only once through lottery.
2. Each participant gets 2+1 minutes to speak on the topic.
3. Participants will be marked on content, organization of thought, delivery, voice modulation & body language.
4. No supporting materials will be allowed during the speech.

name: XpreXive
body: Transform trash into treasure! Show us your creativity by transforming waste into something beautiful and functional. Entries will be evaluated based on the uniqueness of the concept, the effectiveness of the transformation, the sustainability of the materials utilized, and the overall visual appeal and utility of the completed product.

1. Themes and relevant topics will be given on the spot, participants will be allowed to pick their topic only once through lottery.
2. Each participant gets 2+1 minutes to speak on the topic.
3. Participants will be marked on content, organization of thought, delivery, voice modulation & body language.
4. No supporting materials will be allowed during the speech.

name: Artistix
body: Let your brushes dance over the canvas! Paint your interpretation of the supplied themes. We would love to see artworks that not only demonstrate technical competence, but also communicate emotion, depth, and interpretation. Entries should be creative in their composition, color use, and overall visual impact.

rules.body: Participants are required to bring their own art paper and necessary painting materials.
Will be announced 30 minutes prior to the event.

body:
1. Originality: Participants must create original artwork during the competition. Plagiarism or copying from existing artwork is strictly prohibited.
2. Adherence to Theme: Artwork must reflect the theme provided for the competition. Deviating from the theme may result in disqualification.
3. Respectful Content: Artwork should be appropriate for a diverse audience and should not contain offensive or explicit content. Any artwork deemed inappropriate will be disqualified from the competition.
4. Pencil Sketches will not be considered.
